name: Animate Dead

rulings.text: When putting a card onto the battlefield that requires a definition for its value or some other choice, you do what is needed to define the value or make the choice.

This is a new wording. Animate Dead is now an Aura. You target a creature card in a graveyard when you cast it. It enters the battlefield attached to that card. Then it returns that card to the battlefield, and attaches itself to that card again (since the card is treated as a new object on the battlefield).

Once the creature is returned to the battlefield, Animate Dead can't be attached to anything other than it (unless Animate Dead somehow manages to put a different creature onto the battlefield). Attempting to move Animate Dead to another creature won't work.

If the creature card put onto the battlefield has Protection from Black (or anything that prevents this from legally being attached), this won't be able to attach to it. Then this will go to the graveyard as a State-Based Action, causing the creature to be sacrificed.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.
originalText:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

name: Blazing Archon

rulings.text: Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can't attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

name: Buried Alive

rulings.text: You can look in your library and then choose to find any number from zero to three creatures after you look at it.

text: Search your library for up to three creature cards and put them into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: Search your library for up to three creature cards and put them into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: The scrape of shovels and the tumble of cold dirt soon muffled their pleas.

name: Cabal Therapy

rulings.text: You name the card during resolution, then your opponent reveals their hand and discards if appropriate. There is no way for your opponent to do anything between you naming the card and them discarding.

text:
Name a nonland card. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards with that name.
Flashback—Sacrifice a creature. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
originalText:
Name a nonland card. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards with that name.
Flashback—Sacrifice a creature. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

text:
Flying
Whenever Crosis, the Purger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, choose a color, then that player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.

Flying

rulings.text: You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

name: Diabolic Servitude

rulings.text: If the creature is on the battlefield and is returned to its owner's hand or is exiled, this card loses track of the creature and has no further effects in the future.

text:
When Diabolic Servitude enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
When the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude dies, exile it and return Diabolic Servitude to its owner's hand.
When Diabolic Servitude leaves the battlefield, exile the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude.
originalText:
When Diabolic Servitude enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
When the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude dies, exile it and return Diabolic Servitude to its owner's hand.
When Diabolic Servitude leaves the battlefield, exile the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude.

name: Faceless Butcher

rulings.text: Three Faceless Butchers cast in succession with no other creatures on the battlefield will result in an infinite loop and the game will be a draw, unless a player somehow interrupts the loop.

name: Hidden Horror

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you choose whether to sacrifice the creature or perform the other action. If you can't perform the other action, then you must sacrifice the creature.
If the creature is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, you may still perform the action if you want.

text: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller puts a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.
originalText: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller puts a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.
name: Terastodon

rulings.text: The targeted permanents may be controlled by different players.

If a targeted permanent has indestructible or regenerates, its controller won't get an Elephant token for it. Similarly, if the targeted permanent is destroyed but a replacement effect moves it to a different zone instead of its owner's graveyard, its controller won't get an Elephant token for it.

text:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
originalText:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
name: Twisted Abomination

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Swampcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Swamp card. After you find a Swamp card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Swampcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Swampcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Swampcycling from being activated.

Swampcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Swampcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Swamp land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Swamp card in your library.

text: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
flavor: Left to itself, nature overflows any container, overthrows any restriction, and overreaches any boundary.
originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
name: Verdant Force

rulings.text: Verdant Force's controller gets the tokens. That is the controller at the beginning of upkeep.
Once created, the tokens are independent of Verdant Force. If Verdant Force changes controllers, the new controller will put tokens onto the battlefield, but existing tokens will stay where they are.
In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

name: Zombie Infestation
text: Discard two cards: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
originalText: Discard two cards: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
flavor: The nomads' funeral pyres are more practical than ceremonial.
